reviewText:
This game will never die.  From 1999 to the present, this game has been at the heart of Esports throughout.  After Challenge Pro Mode Arena (CPMA) was released the competitive community divided.  Since then, the game's popularity has seen a steady decline.  Currently, there is only a small crowd of hardcore fans that still enjoy this game.

Around 2007-2008 a new iteration of this game came along as a free-to-play web version named QuakeLive.  Download QLPrism (standalone browser made specifically to run QuakeLive) to fully enjoy.  As a pro-subscriber in Quakelive you can spawn servers to run all kinds of fun gameplay from simple duels to team based games and now Quakelive even includes Race mode (Quake3 DeFRaG Mod).  Quakelive is constantly updated with new content (gametypes, maps, custom options) making it the most comprehensive Quake ever.

Quake 3 is one of the most enduring games in all of FPS history.  The gameplay is dynamic, engaging and unique.  If you are a fan of fast-paced, deathmatch style gameplay, Quake3/Quakelive is the ONLY game for you.  Takes years to master, takes seconds to become addicted.

Currently, there is some debate over whom the G.O.A.T. (Greatest Of All Time) of QuakeLive is.  The greatest contenders for the title include the two finalists of Dreamhack Winter 2013, the Belarussian Cypher" or the American "Rapha."  Other names through the years include American "Zero4"

reviewText:
/!\ Before you start this game ***DISABLE STEAM OVERLAY*** to get it working. /!\n
This game absolutely rocked the FPS world back in the day. As a young pre-teen, I played my sports outside, did my homework and when I could, I'd jump on the PC to play this. If you have played Unreal tournament, it may ring a few familiar bells while playing this. If you can tolerate old graphics, you'll able to enjoy the gameplay.

What is Quake 3 : Arena? It is a first person shooter (FPS) multi-player focused game with fast pace featuring players duking it out for in front of a race called the Vadrigar. All the player movements are normal (four directional + strafing) with the addition of jumping. Mouse button 3 will allow the player to zoom and C will let the player crouch. Throughout the map there are items available for pick-up in which the player can press enter to use them. The basic strategy back in the day was jumping up and down and strafing while shooting. Playing the game today after so many years seems players have really figured out this technique and it's almost near impossible for me to hit them. Most servers are decently friendly (for n00bs as well) but some servers have some very good players. Most FPS's will demand a lot of attention from the player but this FPS will keep you moving due to paranoia. Non-stop movement is recommended.

The AI within the game is actually a formidable opponent. Upon first playing the game, I had some serious trouble beating the first level. I got back on the horse eventually and was able to ride to the next tier. One player mode will have you square off against stronger and stronger opponents the more you progress. The weapons in the game are outlandish in design and style while having their strong and weak points. Some weapons will benefit the player from a long range while some will demand a shorter range. The BFG10K is a plasma based weapon that can fire rapidly. The gauntlet is a short ranged melee type weapon in which the announcer will announce humiliation" if an opposing player is killed. The gauntlet does not require ammo. The lightning gun fires a beam of "lightning" and is useful for groups of opponents. The railgun fires a hot slug rounds at a high velocity. It would be better to use this gun from a distance. The plasma gun obviously fires burst of plasma but is slow regarding it's firing rate. There is also a rocket launcher (that is pretty self explanatory and is my favorite weapon as it can make players bounce or explode). The last two include a machine gun and a grenade launcher. All the guns are fun to use but players will find their own style which work for them.

There are items scattered throughout the level and respawn after a short amount of time. The first item includes a red armor icon which has the most defense out of all armors. The yellow armor is half as good as the red and armor shards (pieces) will increase your armor by increments of +5. Besides armor

reviewText:
This was a game I found lying around my computer desk as a kid. After my first experience playing Quake II, which you can check that review for the experience, I had no idea what to expect from Quake III except greatness. It could have been a new single player, an enhanced multiplayer, really anything. But the word Arena was the next word I saw on the disk. I was a pretty smart kid, so I knew it was going to have a badass multiplayer. Little did I know that it was going to be ALL multiplayer.

So I booted up the game after installing it and started watching the intro. It showed some guy shooting down things and running out of ammo. The guy runs away and then decides to rush in. Immediately, I was a little unimpressed. After the Quake II intro, I was expecting awesomeness! Now it was just showing a cliche FPS sequence. Then, after diving towards the enemies, something unexpected happens. Time freezes as the guy is being teleported to some unknown place. This is where id Software did NOT disappoint! After being teleported, it then shows some gameplay of what I was going to be playing with random letters zooming out. I watched the gameplay and knew it had to be awesome. Then, the legendary words filled the CRT monitor.

QUAKE III ARENA

I was hyped. I could not wait. So I went to the options to peek around and noticed there was a better Player Setup screen than Quake II. You could actually see who you were choosing before you picked them. MUCH better than having to scroll through the different models in Quake II to pick your character. And yes. Before you ask, the same customization of Quake II with being able to play as many different characters is avaliable here too. After picking this weird alien thing named Flisk, I immediately went into the game.

The graphics looked really nice. I was gazing upon the room I was in and noticed all the little details in the room. My eyes were like a kid in a candy store. The textures popped out like flowers in a field. The graphical detail was legend, and everything just seemed amazing. Then I noticed the mirror in the room. I gazed at my reflection and loved the little details on my character.

Another thing I noticed was the sudden announcer coming through my speakers. WELCOME TO QUAKE III ARENA!!" I had never heard such a thing in a video game before. It was really mindblowing at the time. I then decided to test fire the guns I had collected. The machinegun sounded like a more powerful version of the one from Quake II
date: and the Shotgun sounded like it was the most devastating thing in the game. I decided to go outside the room and see what was going on around the map.\n\nI immediately ran into Crash

reviewText:
An Awesome and Highly Addictive Arena FPS That will Test & Develop Your FPS Skills!
Quake III Arena is an awesome fast-paced arena-styled multiplayer FPS game. A pure deathmatch game at it's best. The controls are perfect, the vanilla graphics are still good today, and the gameplay... â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ing awesome! One of my favorite features is the ability to play against bots with friends. Very fun if you just want to co-op in the game.

I will say one thing. This game will test your skills and even help you improve your aim and reaction time as the combat is fast and fierce. After playing this game, I can say I am better at FPS games, especially ones with rocket launchers ;). This is one thing I cannot say you will get from most FPS games. This gives it another reason why this game kicks so much a$$! Not only are you having fun, but you are excersising your hand-to-eye coordination.

Easy To Mod
This game is also very easy to mod. All you need to do is open the .pk3 files in a program like WinZip or WinRar and you can replace the game's sound effects, graphics, and models with custom ones you either downloaded or made yourself.

Talking about mods, I highly recommend downloading ioQuake3 ( http://ioquake3.org ). It replaces Quake 3's rendering engine to suit modern machines giving you better net code and the ability to match your computer's native resolution. You can also download other mods for ioQuake3 to improve the game. Some other mods I recommend is the high res texture pack ( http://ioquake3.org/extras/replacement_content ) and the Metal-Tech v2.0 mod that replaces the textures for the weapons with higher res ones ( http://www.moddb.com/mods/metal-tech-v20-revolutions ).

Conclusion
On final note, this game is pure awesomeness and has a high replay value. If you are interested in playing a fast-paced FPS game to test out or improve upon your twitch skills, this is the game for you!

Weapons in the game are designed well and all of them are fun to use, though it does seem a bit tedious stalking enemies with the machine gun you get right off the bat. Also, it is nice to see the BFG make an appearance.

Heyyo,

It's Quake III Arena... need I say more? ;)

I will anyways lol... graphics that still look nice to this date, very solid netcode and a decent soundtrack. Unreal Tournament (1999) is a better game than this one (in my opinion anyways) but this is still a badass game. I did enjoy the AI in Q3A more than UT99 though since they're much more intelligent which is good since back when I used to play UT99 and Q3A a lot? I was on 56k dialup so I couldn't play MP with more than 4-6 guys or I'd lag out haha.

Quake Live is a better choice these days than Quake III Arena... because it's free, has better support for modern hardware and has a more active community, but this is still a very good nostalgic twitch-fps game.

Ok. Where do i start on this game? Although it appears that I have low play time on this game I actually played a hell of a lot of this game before I was on steam. This game is nuts, but you know..... fun nuts. The maps in this game are fun with not too many camping spots (as if you would feel the need to anyway) and are mostly quite large.

Now....... The guns. Ok, so first up is the Machine Gun which is only good if you are accurate and your enemy is very inaccurate so lets skip this one. Then there is the Shotgun. One hit kill at short range of course and good damage at medium range. The Rocket Launcher is deadly to both your enemy and yourself but can also tend to take a few hits to kills if not hit directly. The Plasma Gun is basically a super Machine Gun. It has a lot more damage and similar fire rate. the Grenade Launcher in my opinion is the hardest gun to use because you have to time as well as place the grenade well. the Railgun, my favourite weapon, is basically a sniper that you have to no scope with (except unlike no scoper's in COD it actually takes skill) and is either a one or two hit kill. The Lightning Gun shoots out a stream of lightning towards your enemy and does decent damage. It's kind of like a Super Soaker except instead of water coming out there's lightning. And finally there is the BFG10K. now this gun is a one hit kill and has a fast automatic fire rate so it kicks â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥.

Now in addition to these guns is the gauntlet, which is basically a glove with a spinning saw blade on it. Its usually a two or three hit kill but its always fun to kill someone with it. also there are several other items that can be placed on the maps such as +5, +25 and +50 health capsules, +5 armour shards, +50 and +100 armour vests, a mega health capsule, a quad damage power-up, as well as a regeneration power-up and a beast power-up. I won't take the time to explain these items (Most of which are pretty self explanatory anyway). The best piece of advice that I can give you is to aim well. You aim well and you win....

Anyway I thoroughly reccomend this game to all and I hope this review helps.

Even if you're just playing against bots, this is some of the best deathmatch out there. Weapons pack a punch and are all distinct and equally destructive (with the exception of the starting machine gun). Maps all have great layouts with intuitive flow, and lend themselves perfectly to the fast paced action and player movement.

In terms of artistic design the map styles don't offer a great deal of variety, but there are countless high quality user made maps available, and just about all are a piece of cake to install. Graphics still hold their own today, 15 years later. Pretty remarkable.

Easy purchase if some fast paced deathmatch is what you're looking for.

Quake III Arena (1998) is a memorable classic in my opinion. Consider this game if you enjoy classics and fast paced FPS gameplay. Even though I think Quake Live is a clone of this which makes it pointless to pay for this.

Quake 3 Arena combines FPS gameplay with extreme speed of reflection and extreme-pace gameplay. As with old games, the game does not have much variation and no customization in comparison to today's games, but can still be a great fun.

The gameplay consists of players; humanoid shaped hitboxes that move at a very fast speed without penalties, with a weapon selection including a rocket launcher, a railgun (one-hit precision killer), a shotgun and a few machine guns. The game modes at least include DM, TDM and CTF, not sure about others.

The gameplay is just about maneuvering and shooting very quickly and precisely. When you die, you respawn right away and the insanely fast fun continues.
